<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out where and when the play Les Sosies is set. Let's start by looking at the JSON provided.

First, the metadata says it's written by Jean de Rotrou in 1668. That gives me a clue about the author and publication date but not necessarily the setting. I know that French plays from the 17th century often drew inspiration from classical themes, so maybe the play is set in an ancient time or place.

Looking at the context section, under people, Amphytrion is mentioned frequently. From what I remember, Amphytrion is a figure from Greek mythology, associated with Thebes. He was the king of Thebes before Oedipus took over. So if Amphytrion is a main character, the setting might be in Thebes.

In the places section, Thrace is mentioned. Thrace is an area in southeastern Europe, known in ancient times as part of the Greek world. So combining both the people and places, it seems like the play could be set in Ancient Greece, specifically around Thebes or Thrace.

As for the time period, since it's a classical theme, the play would likely be set in ancient times. Jean de Rotrou was writing in 1668, but the setting itself isn't tied to that specific date. Instead, it's based on the mythological characters and settings he used. So I'm thinking the timeframe is the Ancient Greek period.

I should confirm if there are other mentions that might point to a different location or time. The other people mentioned include Jupiter, Creon, Mercury, and Alcmene, which all fit into ancient Greek myths and history. Places like Cjel (maybe a variation of Chalcis?), Thebes, and the sea (mer) also reinforce this.

So putting it together, the play is set in Ancient Greece during the time when these mythological figures were prominent. Therefore, the period would be Ancient Greek times, around 1000-500 BCE, though I'm not exactly sure of the exact timeframe since ancient history spans a long period.
</think>
